channel.title: Drinking
channel.description:
dear moparscapers,
I'm going to my first party. My mom told me that I can't get drunk. I'm not intended to get drunk but what if it happens. I will drink some alcohol but are there some ways I can cover it up if I am drunk?
thanks in advance, halflive9

item.title: Drinking
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:47, topic:435736”][quote author=Bokluk link=topic=538455.msg3940943#msg3940943 date=1331414560]
if it’s your first time shitload of puke awaits you from a low amount of alcohol. i always used to get those mint gums, the breath is the only thing you have to cover up.
[/quote]Yes, because a first time drinker will only have bad breath after getting hammered.[/quote]
haha

Read full topic

item.title: Drinking
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Thanks for all the replies. I didn’t get drunk. I limited my drinking to 4 beers and thats it. And I know you can have fun without alcohol. The alcohol is just a part of it? If you see around everyone is drinking you want to drink something too. But again thanks for all the hints.

Read full topic

item.title: Drinking
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:18, topic:435736”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=538455.msg3939942#msg3939942 date=1331336866]

If you don’t want to get grounded and still be able to go to parties in the future, just do what your mom says. You can have fun with alcohol without getting drunk.

This is why you don’t get invited to parties.
[/quote]Why go to parties to get drunk and laid when you can just stay at home on the internet [/quote]
my life^

Read full topic

read edit etc

item.title: Drinking
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:29, topic:435736”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=538455.msg3940076#msg3940076 date=1331344939]
I’m just going to counter, David, with the idea that even though you are missing opportunities that can become bad; you are missing a ton of time to advance your social understanding of people. You think that they just sit on their asses the entire time drinking? There is a ton of mingled conversation and good memories to share. Letting go in a healthy manner is perfectly fine. Also may help take some sticks out of some places in your body.
[/quote][quote author=Dunder Mifflin link=topic=538455.msg3940077#msg3940077 date=1331344968]
I hope you mean by smoking weed or doing E/Cocaine. cause if you meant by not doign ANY of that stuff. you killed my night.
[/quote]Case in point.[/quote]

Conversation while drunk, should have implied.

People under influence show more of their colours than normal people not under the influence do. So you get to know them a bit differently, in good and bad ways, than when their defenses are up. I just don’t differentiate the two experienced greatly because people are people. The way they act drunk is caused by some of their subconscious triggers. It’s not unnatural, they didn’t swap places with a different person. It’s the same person in a different state of mind. Not any different than if you were on a lack of sleep. To give an example, I like my girlfriend when she is high because she doesn’t hold what she is thinking in but lets it out so I can understand where our relationship stands.

Case and point: Substances don’t make people troubled, people were troubled before they started ABUSING substances. Which by the way your argument is all over the place. I get the impression that you don’t enjoy substances but give examples of ‘Nah, I just want to be successful.’. _

You are just a major fun killer, aren’t you…

Read full topic

item.title: Drinking
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:27, topic:435736”]I’m just going to counter, David, with the idea that even though you are missing opportunities that can become bad; you are missing a ton of time to advance your social understanding of people. You think that they just sit on their asses the entire time drinking? There is a ton of mingled conversation and good memories to share. Letting go in a healthy manner is perfectly fine. Also may help take some sticks out of some places in your body.[/quote]Like I said and you aknowledged, you don’t need drugs or alcohol to advance your social understanding or have conversation. Plus a lot of the time when you are drunk/high you aren’t yourself, meaning your social understanding and the way others perceive you may change if you are doing it in an unnatural environment.[quote=“Dunder Mifflin, post:28, topic:435736”]I hope you mean by smoking weed or doing E/Cocaine. cause if you meant by not doign ANY of that stuff. you killed my night.[/quote]Case in point.

Read full topic

it’s also possible to have fun with no alcohol.[/quote]

item.title: Drinking
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:24, topic:435736”][quote author=Travas link=topic=538455.msg3939946#msg3939946 date=1331337081]

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=538455.msg3939942#msg3939942 date=1331336866]

If you don’t want to get grounded and still be able to go to parties in the future, just do what your mom says. You can have fun with alcohol without getting drunk.

This is why you don’t get invited to parties.
[/quote]Why go to parties to get drunk and laid when you can just stay at home on the internet
[/quote]Why get drunk and possibly regret it later

[quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=538455.msg3940000#msg3940000 date=1331340201]
You’re 16 years old and you’re worried your mummy will tell you off for drinking a bit of booze?

…
[/quote]She specifically said not to get drunk, not that he couldn’t drink

Point - Some people do a lot of stupid shit when they get drunk, she’s trying to save you possible embarrassment or trouble with the law. She obviously doesn’t care if you drink, so that’s the only reason I can think of for not wanting you to get drunk.

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=538455.msg3939942#msg3939942 date=1331336866]

If you don’t want to get grounded and still be able to go to parties in the future, just do what your mom says. You can have fun with alcohol without getting drunk.

This is why you don’t get invited to parties.
[/quote]I actually did get invited to parties a while back. I usually declined because I have different standards than most of the people in my area so they stopped bothering. And when I look at those people now I honestly don’t regret my decision at all.

I know a lot of ‘teenagers’ and sometimes college students (I guess we could just say like… 15-25) disagree with me, saying that it’s more important to have fun or whatever, but you can look at successful people and their accomplishments, and you don’t see ‘got drunk a lot in highschool’, ‘got laid at a lot of parties’, or ‘got so stoned I felt amazing’ in those lists. Just sayin’.

I guess my point is, I don’t see why people rely so much on these drugs and alcohol to have a good time if it involves clouding your own judgement, and then make fun of people that don’t/wont do it. (Or say parties without alcohol are lame, etc)[/quote]

I’m just going to wait for our peers to come up with a witty response.

Read full topic

item.title: Drinking
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:18, topic:435736”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=538455.msg3939942#msg3939942 date=1331336866]

If you don’t want to get grounded and still be able to go to parties in the future, just do what your mom says. You can have fun with alcohol without getting drunk.

This is why you don’t get invited to parties.
[/quote]Why go to parties to get drunk and laid when you can just stay at home on the internet [/quote]Why get drunk and possibly regret it later

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:22, topic:435736”]You’re 16 years old and you’re worried your mummy will tell you off for drinking a bit of booze?

…[/quote]She specifically said not to get drunk, not that he couldn’t drink

Point - Some people do a lot of stupid shit when they get drunk, she’s trying to save you possible embarrassment or trouble with the law. She obviously doesn’t care if you drink, so that’s the only reason I can think of for not wanting you to get drunk.

[quote=“sinisoul, post:17, topic:435736”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=538455.msg3939863#msg3939863 date=1331331995]
If you don’t want to get grounded and still be able to go to parties in the future, just do what your mom says. You can have fun with alcohol without getting drunk.
[/quote]

This is why you don’t get invited to parties.[/quote]I actually did get invited to parties a while back. I usually declined because I have different standards than most of the people in my area so they stopped bothering. And when I look at those people now I honestly don’t regret my decision at all.

I know a lot of ‘teenagers’ and sometimes college students (I guess we could just say like… 15-25) disagree with me, saying that it’s more important to have fun or whatever, but you can look at successful people and their accomplishments, and you don’t see ‘got drunk a lot in highschool’, ‘got laid at a lot of parties’, or ‘got so stoned I felt amazing’ in those lists. Just sayin’.

I guess my point is, I don’t see why people rely so much on these drugs and alcohol to have a good time if it involves clouding your own judgement, and then make fun of people that don’t/wont do it. (Or say parties without alcohol are lame, etc)

Read full topic
